TopicTitle: [1.5.1] Engine Lighting (1.5.1) Little Config Update (13 October)

Articles.Content:
Occasionally getting an effect where the entire planet is lit up:

Can't isolate exact circumstances under which it appears.

Relevant graphical mods in use:

EVE 7-4 (default)

Texture Replacer 2.4.4 (no textures installed yet)

Distant Object Enhancement 1.5.5 (default)

PlanetShine 0.2.3.1 (default)

Ambient Light Adjustment

Ven's Stock Part Revamp

Occasionally getting an effect where the entire planet is lit up:

[iMAGE]

Can't isolate exact circumstances under which it appears.

...

Hmm that's weird!

Is it happening for only a very short moment? Maybe it's Krakensbane recentering the world, messing cordinates...

I have had it to happen with stock lights, but only on heavy timewarp, not at realtime.

Going to try to reproduce it!

Hmm that's weird!

Is it happening for only a very short moment? Maybe it's Krakensbane recentering the world, messing cordinates...

I have had it to happen with stock lights, but only on heavy timewarp, not at realtime.

Going to try to reproduce it!

The planet is illuminated as long as the engine is running. Kinda reminded me of how B9s spotlights used to light up the whole planet. I also noticed that if I scroll out to move the camera away from the ship, the effect isn't seen any more.

Realistically, I probably need to disable the listed mods one-by-one to find any conflicts.

Kinda reminded me of how B9s spotlights used to light up the whole planet

Yup, that was my first thought as well, might be a good avenue for tajampi to investigate

Realistically, I probably need to disable the listed mods one-by-one to find any conflicts.

Do the binary sort method, it's faster. Take out half your mods and test. If the problem is gone, switch to the other half and test. If it's back, take out half of those mods and repeat.

I love this mod, it is now an essential part of my graphics mods package. It's awesome with HotRockets by Nazari.

I think it was mentioned earlier, it provides glow for the firespitter engines in Freight Transport Technologies by RoverDude. I like the effect, but obviously not meant to be like that.

For those of you using HotRockets but are annoyed at how the nuclear engine produces a yellow light even though its exhaust is purple, add this to your patches.cfg:

@PART[nuclearEngine]:FOR[EngineLight]
{
  @MODULE[tjs_EngineLight]
  {
		@lightGreen = 0.55
		@lightBlue = 0.93
		@jitterMultiplier = 15.3
  }
}

It makes the engine emit a purple light that matches with its exhaust.

Maybe would it be possible to just disable the light on IVA materials? Or is that not possible?

It's possible, just fairly hard, as it will require some investigations on what layers are IVA stuff at, etc...

I have implemented a multiplier you can modify (on the patches.cfg file) that reduces the light on IVA, works nicely!

I will be releasing soon, uploading all the stuff...

EDIT: I am also adding code for disabling SQUAD's engine light that's by default on some (or all, i'm not sure) engines, so release will take a few minutes more

EDIT2: Apparently so little engines have a default light, it's not worth implementing code for disabling it, for now! Releasing in a few minutes, finishing testing, and uploading!

Cheers!
